clientInfo.name: Mike Maples, Jr
clientInfo.title: Seed investing OG at Floodgate; Author of the bestselling book Pattern Breakers, available wherever you buy books. Co-conspirator with awesome Startup Founders who want to dominate the future.

keyHighlights: Average likes per post of 105 indicates consistent engagement.
Top post achieved 681 likes, highlighting the strong impact of image content.
Image posts average engagement of 271 is significantly higher than text posts at 30.
Posts on weekends, especially Sunday, receive exceptionally high engagement.
executiveSummary.summaryText: This report provides a comprehensive analysis of Mike Maples, Jr's LinkedIn engagement performance during May 2025. It examines post types, audience demographics, and posting patterns to highlight strengths and areas for improvement. The analysis integrates data on content performance, and influencer benchmarks. Overall, it offers data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to enhance future engagement.

contentAnalysis.visualImpactInsight: Image posts (avg engagement: 271) tend to perform significantly better than text posts (avg engagement: 30).
contentAnalysis.postTypeDistributionInsight: The majority of posts are text (38.89%) and images (30.56%), suggesting a balanced content strategy with room to leverage stronger visual storytelling.

topPerformingPosts.content: From the very beginning (even before the beginning) it was clear that Applied Intuition founders Qasar Younis and Peter Ludwig were among the best founders I had ever encountered. Today, Applied Intu...

I had already read this story from @chriskornelis from the Wall Street Journal. I am grateful he took the time to cover it. But in print, it hits different. I've heard a lot of stuff about "founder mode"...

Beginning today, my forthcoming book Pattern Breakers, written with Peter Ziebelman, is available for pre-order. I’ve been working on this for quite awhile, and I’m so excited that it’s finally ready for prime time...

Aaron Levie is a special kind of founder. He started Box nearly 20 years ago, has gotten it to past $1B in revenue, and is back in founder mode in a big way. Where most would embrace life as an established company CEO...

postingPatternsAnalysis.timingKeyFinding: Posts on Saturday and Sunday tend to receive significantly higher engagement.

topIndustryInfluencersAnalysis.overview: The analysis identifies six key influencers with diverse strategies and significant engagement impact.

post.text: We're selling our home in Hillsborough after moving to Austin last year. If you're interested before it goes on market in June email me jason@calacanis.com

influencers.name: Mark Cuban
influencers.title: President
influencers.descriptionFocus: High-profile entrepreneur and investor known for disruptive business leadership and deep startup insights.

post.text: Healthcare is a very simple business. We go to the Dr. The Dr tells us what we need (if anything). The ONLY questions are: 1. What does it cost 2. How will the patient pay for it Everything else is a complication. Unfortunately, those complications have removed all alignment between patients and the economics of healthcare The big insurance companies and the PBMs they own, create almost all of the complications. They are able to do so because they control the flow of patients for hospitals/providers and drug manufacturers. They are the gatekeepers for trillions of dollars of healthcare spending. Everyone has to kiss their ass and accept the complications. And they know the more they can complicate it, the better the financial engineering they can do

influencers.name: Tomasz Tunguz
influencers.title: Venture Capitalist at Theory
influencers.descriptionFocus: General Partner at Theory Ventures, offering data-driven insights into early-stage startup trends and venture capital strategy.

post.text: Today, were announcing our second fund of $450m to support our mission of partnering with early stage software companies that leverage technology discontinuities into go-to-market advantages. This marks the next chapter in our firms evolution. Since we launched Theory Ventures in 2023, weve gathered a wonderful team : Lauren DeMeuse, Spencer Farrar, Andy Triedman, Rafa Jara Simkin, Amber (., Arjun Mishra, & Kristin Beach. We have partnered with 8 marvelous founding teams, all using data to power the next wave of innovation across the Modern Data Stack, Artificial Intelligence, & Web3. Weve grown our fund size to match the needs of founders in this market : average Series A rounds have increased 42% since our launch, a reflection of the growth potential of these software categories. Im grateful to our team, our founders, & our limited partners for the continued support, & to Allie Garfinkle for sharing more about Theory (

influencers.name: Garry Tan
influencers.title: President & CEO, Y Combinator
influencers.descriptionFocus: Leader at Y Combinator with vast experience in startup acceleration, investor mentoring, and scaling early-stage companies.

post.text: The point of a startup is to make usable technology for others. When you make software, you have to watch at least 10 people use it. Sit next to them and say absolutely nothing. Force yourself to marinate in the failure of your product design. Every version 1 of any software will be absolutely destroyed by first interaction with users. You need to watch your new creation be absolutely misunderstood by users to reform version 1 into the one that actually works. There is only one path: figuring out where the sharp edges, the places people get caught, the assumptions you make as a builder that turn out to be wrong, and then relentlessly sanding it down so that anyone can use it. That is good design. That is the key to a good product. There is no shortcut for this. WATCH USERS AND CRINGE AND THEN FIX IT. SAND DOWN THE EDGES.

influencerComparison.name: Trace Cohen
influencerComparison.topThemes: Vertical AI focus & Deep tech investor

summaryOfComparison: The client shows steady engagement but can improve visual content and posting frequency to match top industry influencers who emphasize diverse, data-driven, and video-rich content.

gapAnalysis.gap: Lower engagement rate on text posts

gapAnalysis.recommendedAction: Adopt a more consistent posting schedule

gapAnalysis.influencerAverage: Diverse content including video and articles

recommendations.contentStrategy: Diversify content themes by incorporating more industry insights and personal stories.
recommendations.visualElements: Enhance visual storytelling with higher quality image and video content.
recommendations.postingSchedule: Increase posting frequency to 3-4 times per week, especially during high engagement days.
recommendations.audienceTargeting: Focus on engaging audiences in technology and finance sectors with tailored content.
recommendations.engagementTactics: Utilize interactive elements such as polls and Q&A sessions to boost audience interaction.
